title: Toward Optimal ANC: Establishing Mutual Information Lower Bound
author: François Derrida (Ben-Gurion University of the Negev), Shahar Lutati (Tel Aviv University), Eliya Nachmani (Ben-Gurion University of the Negev), ...
relevance_why: The paper establishes foundational theoretical limits for Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) methods, which could inform the design and evaluation of audio processing algorithms in Haohe Liu's research.
background: This paper derives theoretical limits on Active Noise Cancellation systems, focusing on information-theoretic and support-based constraints to establish performance bounds.
contribution: This paper introduces a unified lower bound on the cancellation performance of ANC systems to evaluate and guide algorithm improvements.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous ANC methods lacked a standardized framework for assessing cancellation limits, often relying on empirical results that vary across setups.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work combines information-theoretic analysis with physical support limitations to propose a robust theoretical ceiling on the achievable noise cancellation.

key_innovation: Integrates two perspectives—information-theoretic and spectral support constraints—to create a comprehensive performance benchmark for ANC algorithms.
real_world_impact: The theoretical benchmarks established in this work can guide future improvements in ANC technologies, enhancing user experiences in various noisy environments.
limitations: The requirement for high-quality data to compute the information-theoretic bounds could restrict the applicability across settings with limited audio samples.

new_terms.Active Noise Cancellation (ANC): **Active Noise Cancellation (ANC)** refers to technology that uses anti-noise sound waves to minimize unwanted background noise.
new_terms.Normalized Mean Squared Error (NMSE): **Normalized Mean Squared Error (NMSE)** is a performance metric used to quantify the effectiveness of noise cancellation systems.
